title: What is the largest brass instrument in an orchestra? - Quora

response.answer_text: Usually the tuba:  The average BBb bass tuba (as opposed to the smaller “tenor tuba” aka euphonium) has roughly 18 feet of primary tubing, from lead pipe to bell. The euphonium, by comparison, has about half that. Now, that’s the largest brass instrument that has a regular place in the orchestra.
